instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2014 Turning on by battery not by AC
threads.message:
Liquid Damage Macbook Pro

Originally No green light no power... dead

<CHIP>U3210</CHIP> was short. removed it and replaced it 

<CHIP>U7090</CHIP> had broken trace. replaced and jumped wire

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> had broken trace too. jumped wire and replaced

Now i get green light but doesnt turn on. plug in with battery and it turns on. However does not charge battery

so i replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> maybe a bad one. same thing.

Please let me know what other steps i can take

TIA

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2014 Turning on by battery not by AC
threads.message:
What voltage is on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with charger only?
Measure resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 at <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
Check traces and resistors for corrosion in that area...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2014 Turning on by battery not by AC
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with charger only -3.73v (that's low?

17/18 4ohm

and 27/28 20ohm (this seems low)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2014 Turning on by battery not by AC
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBIS_G3H</SIGNAL> should be 12.56V, remove F7140 and check if <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> goes high.......

threads.message: Bad <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> or bad soldering is my first guess here. Check for corroded traces around there too.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2014 Turning on by battery not by AC
threads.message:
No Title

I changed a new one. Same thing. All connections looks fine. 

Heres a before and after of the area. After installing the chip again. I know the connections is what's important. They all look fine.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2014 Turning on by battery not by AC
threads.message: Looks like pin 20 has the wire. Is the 5V1 present on pin 19 and 20?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2014 Turning on by battery not by AC
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2014 Turning on by battery not by AC
threads.message:
Resistance to ground at F7140?
Post voltages for <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> pins 2, 19, 20, 12, 13, 3, 14, 9, 15, 1, 26.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2014 Turning on by battery not by AC
threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> was the issue. replaced and it works thanks
